com.projetloki.genesis.image

Class MathVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projetloki.genesis.image.MathVector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function<Point,Point>, Serializable

    public final class MathVector
extends Object
implements Function<Point,Point>, Serializable
    An immutable geometric vector, represented by its x- and y- coordinates in the plane. Not to be confused with the collection vector.
    Author:
    Cl√©ment Roux
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      The vector with coordinates (0, 0).

      • of

        public static MathVector of(double dx,
            double dy)
        Constructs a vector with the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        dx - the x-coordinate of this vector
        dy - the y-coordinate of this vector
        See Also:
        to construct a vector from two points

      • dot

        public double dot(MathVector v)
        Returns the dot product of this and the given vector, defined as dx * dx' + dy * dy'.
        Parameters:
        v - the right operand of the dot product
        Returns:
        the dot product of this and v

      • dx

        public double dx()
        Returns the x-coordinate of this vector.

      • dy

        public double dy()
        Returns the y-coordinate of this vector.

      • norm

        public double norm()
        Returns the Euclidean norm (or length) of this vector. The term 'norm' is preferred to the term 'length' to avoid confusion between the geometric vector, and the collection.
        Returns:
        the Euclidean norm of this vector

      • theta

        public double theta()
        Returns the angle between vector I and this, in the range of -pi through pi. If this is the zero vector, returns Double.NaN.
        Returns:
        the angle between vector I and this
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this is the zero vector

      • isZero

        public boolean isZero()
        Returns whether the norm of this vector equals 0.
        Returns:
        whether the norm of this vector equals 0

      • minus

        public MathVector minus(MathVector v)
        Returns the vector obtained by substracting the coordinates of the given vector from this vector's coordinates.
        Parameters:
        v - the right operand of the substraction
        Returns:
        this - v

      • negate

        public MathVector negate()
        Returns the vector obtained by multiplying this vector's coordinates by -1. This is a shortcut for scale(-1).
        Returns:
        -this

      • normalize

        public MathVector normalize()
        Returns the vector obtained by dividing this vector by its norm. Note that although this vector is supposed to return a unit vector, the value returned by norm() is rarely exactly 1, because of loss of precision.
        Returns:
        a unit vector with the same direction as this
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this is the zero vector

      • plus

        public MathVector plus(MathVector v)
        Returns the vector obtained by adding the coordinates of the given vector to this vector's coordinates.
        Parameters:
        v - the right operand of the addition
        Returns:
        this + v

      • rotate

        public MathVector rotate(double theta)
        Returns the image of this vector by the clockwise rotation through the given angle.
        Parameters:
        theta - in radians
        Returns:
        the image of this vector by the specified rotation

      • rotateCcw

        public MathVector rotateCcw()
        Returns the image of this vector by the counterclockwise rotation through pi / 2. This is a shortcut for rotate(-Math.PI / 2)
        Returns:
        the image of this vector by the counterclockwise rotation through the angle pi / 2

      • rotateCw

        public MathVector rotateCw()
        Returns the image of this vector by the clockwise rotation through pi / 2. This is a shortcut for rotate(Math.PI / 2)
        Returns:
        the image of this vector by the clockwise rotation through the angle pi / 2

      • scale

        public MathVector scale(double factor)
        Returns the vector obtained by multiplying this vector's coordinates by the given factor.
        Parameters:
        factor - a scalar
        Returns:
        factor . this
